Talk01_29:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, hello again...


Now, I don't care how young you are,
you're gonna catch a cold running around
looking like a Cucco who fell in a lake.
Talk01_30:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>The previous chief planted these beautiful
plum trees on the day I was born.

They're...<sp:5:0:0>a part of me. I take care of them
like I would take care of my own children.

Cori over with that survey team shows
my trees proper respect, so I let her use
part of my garden for her research.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>She uses it to grow something called a
<clr:0000>sundelion<clr:ffff>. It seems important, so I keep
careful watch and don't fuss with it.
Talk01_31:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Chat_00>Sometimes I wonder if I care too much.
But this place is important, so I'll take
care of it the best I can.
Talk01_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>My watch over the plum garden is done
for the evening. If I don't head home
soon, my old man will fret away.
Talk01_34:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm heading home. Cori, that sweet
girl, is watching the plum garden for me.
Talk01_36:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oho, you really do like these <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff>!


I can't say I understand all this <clr:0000>sky island<clr:ffff>
and <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff> business.

But if this plum garden is helping your
research, I'm pleased as can be.
Talk01_37:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Very well! Evidence indicates that
<clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff> come from the <clr:0000>sky islands<clr:ffff>, so
it would be a triumph to grow them here.
Even better, our research also indicates
that consuming them may impart a
resistance to <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>, soâ€”
ReturnHome_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0901>You won't get away with this! <sp:5:0:0>We have
guard Cuccos here!

<sp:3:0:2:0000>Hm? Oh...it's that traveler. <sp:5:1:0>Good grief!
You scared the life out of me.
Talk01_38:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Early test results indicate that consuming
sundelions may provide resistance
to <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>.
Perhaps there's some connection to their
native habitat on the <clr:0000>sky islands<clr:ffff>...
ReturnHome_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Or not. <sp:5:0:0>Good grief, don't you know what
this looks like?
Talk01_39:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oho, nothing can stop you when you get
going about <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff>!

I can't say all this <clr:0000>sky island<clr:ffff> and <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>
business makes a lick of sense to me...

But it does my heart good to know this
plum garden is helping your work. Just
goes to show what a bit of care can do.
Talk01_12:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I know, I know. The moment someone
tells you not to do something, that's all
you want to do.
I was young once. I've been there.
But let me tell you,<sp:5:1:0> sonny,<sp:5:1:0> you have
to grow up eventually...
Talk01_42:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I know monsters don't come into the
village, but going out at night still gives
me the willies.
Talk01_43:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'd dearly love to visit a friend who's
<clr:0000>laid up in bed<clr:ffff>, but <clr:0000>Lasli<clr:ffff> is taking care of
her. I don't want to be a bother.
Talk01_44:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>Hmph. If I want to have the energy to
keep an eye out tomorrow, I gotta call
it a day today.
Talk01_45:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>When you get to be my age, you'll see
how much of a blessing it is to have a
comfortable life with no surprises.
Seeing my plums every day is the only
thing that keeps me going.
Talk01_16:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkDeny_00>Get away from my plums!<sp:5:1:0> Go on...
Shoo... Mmmph...
PlumGarden_Kakariko008_Water_01: <sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Hey! Just WHAT are you doing? Hm?
Talk01_46:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Notice_00>Hm? Maybe it's my age showing, but I
thought we already talked about this...
Talk01_17:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>I'm glad our village has gotten livelier now
that Paya is our chief.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But with all of these new faces, I'm
worried sick someone will mess with
my <clr:0000>plum garden<clr:ffff>...
Talk01_47:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Chat_00>With all the new folks flitting about visiting
the Ring Ruins, this plum garden isn't just
for me anymore.
I'm pleased it's gonna bring smiles to a
lot of new faces...but that means there's
a lot of new faces to keep an eye on.
PlumGarden_Kakariko008_Water_03:
<sp:5:0:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Were you... <sp:5:0:0>Were you trying to water my
plum garden?

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I've had so many rowdy hooligans
come through here and show these
trees nothing but disrespect...
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Turns out some young people actually do
care about plant life.
Talk01_48:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c00>Oh, yes! I should go see <clr:0000>Nanna<clr:ffff> today. I hope she's
not still <clr:0000>laid up in bed<clr:ffff>...

And that sweet granddaughter of hers, <clr:0000>Lasli<clr:ffff>, has
been run ragged. Poor dear.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk01_19:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal_01>You've taken quite the fancy to these
trees, haven't you?

It's not often a young fellow like yourself
takes an interest.
PlumGarden_Kakariko008_Water_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>But with Cori and me here, the trees are
well taken care of, so no need to worry.
Talk01_20:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_01>Oh ho ho!<sp:5:0:0> Surprised?


I've been training Cuccos to swoop on
any rapscallions who try to mess with
these trees!
You heard of guard dogs?<sp:5:0:0> Well, try
guard Cuccos!

Hurting my garden isn't a mistake
someone will make more than once.
Oh ho ho...<sp:5:0:0> No indeed...
Talk01_49:
<sp:3:0:2:0901>Any scoundrel who tries to mess with my
plum trees will learn their lesson.

Now stand up straight and listen up!
PlumGarden_Kakariko008_Water_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>But since it's raining today, there's really
no need to water the garden.
Talk01_21:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>I sure hope Nanna's doing OK. At least
she's getting some rest at <clr:0000>home<clr:ffff>.
Talk01_50:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Chat_00>Ahem. Plums symbolize endurance
and prosperity.

The way they persevere through the
harshness of winter and flower at the
first sign of spring...
We Sheikah were once driven out of the
kingdom. We strive to live in harmony with
the world around us.
We consider plum trees the silent
guardians of our village.

These trees were planted by the previous
chief on the day I was born.

Here is the story...
Item_Plant_R_Kakariko008_Angry:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Hey! What are you doing?! <sp:5:1:0>Cori has put
a lot of work into raising that plant.<sp:0:4:0>Don't mess with it!
Talk01_22:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I was so worried about vandals, <sp:5:0:0>I've been
out there every night keeping watch.

But with Cori there, that sweet girl, I can
go get some shut-eye.

<sp:3:0:2:0100>Thank Hylia for the Zonai Survey Team.
Talk01_51:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>So, what I've been trying to say is that
these plum trees are full of the
previous chief's devotion.
Get it?<sp:5:1:0> Well?<sp:5:1:0>
Talk01_52:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkDeny>Well, I never!<sp:5:1:0> Thank goodness I keep
watch over my <clr:0000>plum garden<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0000>I'm glad our village has gotten livelier with
Paya as chief...

But now I have to watch out for
delinquents like you!
Item_Plant_R_Kakariko008_Angry_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Hey! Cut it out!


These plum trees are a precious gift from
our former chief!

Don't you mess with them!
Talk01_53:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease>Well, I never!<sp:5:1:0> Thank goodness I keep
watch over my <clr:0000>plum garden<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:1:0>

Are you one of those tourists who've
come to poke around the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>?

A lot of older folks live around here.
We used to be a quiet little town.

But since our Paya became chief, we're
neck-deep in young folks running around.
I'm glad we have some new blood...
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkDeny>But I'll keep my eye out for hooligans
like you!
Talk01_24:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm going to keep watch over my <clr:0000>plum
garden<clr:ffff>. Would you like to join me?
Talk01_25:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal>Hm? Are you one of those tourists who've
come to poke around the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>?

<sp:3:0:2:0000>A lot of older folks live around here.<sp:5:0:0>
This little village used to be as quiet
as a dusty old tomb.
But then Paya became chief, and lots of
you youthful types have been coming
around. Now it's quite lively!
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>I just worry that with all the new folks
running around, something might happen
to my <clr:0000>plum garden<clr:ffff>...
Talk01_54:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>Hey! Are you even listening?


<sp:3:0:2:0701>Fine then. I guess I have been going on
and on about it.

But from now on, you'd better not hurt
something others hold dear. And not
just plum trees!
Item_Plant_R_Kakariko008_Angry_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_01>That's it. You'd better start listening when
people talk to you.<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:7d00>Don't mess with my plum garden!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk01_55:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice>Now, I don't care how young you are,
you're gonna catch a cold running around
looking like a Cucco who fell in a lake.
Item_Plant_R_Kakariko008_Angry_03: <sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>E-eeek! <sp:5:0:0>It's on fire!<sp:0:4:0>Put it out! <sp:5:1:0>Put it out quick!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:2:2:6400>
